intro: Chamerion colchicum, commonly known as fireweed, is a flowering plant in the evening primrose family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to North America and thrives in disturbed soils, such as those found in roadsides and wastelands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and can store nutrients. Fireweed is also known for its ability to reseed itself and is often among the first plants to colonize burned or cleared areas.
